alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...AN AREA OF THUNDERSTORMS WITH HEAVY RAIN WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN ISLE OF WIGHT...AND SOUTHEASTERN YORK COUNTIES...THE CITY OF POQUOSON...THE CITY OF NORFOLK...THE NORTH CENTRAL CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH...THE NORTHEASTERN CITY OF SUFFOLK...THE NORTHWESTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH...THE CITY OF HAMPTON AND THE CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS... At 519 PM EDT, radar indicated clusters of thunderstorms with heavy rain centered along a line extending from near Fort Eustis to Fort Monroe. The thunderstorms were moving very slowly. An additional 1 to 2 inches of rain is possible. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Hampton, Smithfield, Langley AFB, Ocean View, Virginia Wesleyan University, Hampton University, Old Dominion University, Christopher Newport University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Patrick Henry Field, Downtown Portsmouth, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Seaford, Norfolk, Chesapeake and Portsmouth. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may cause localized flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach; York
